messages.message:
:point_up_2: Tangential, what would be a stable URL pointing to the latest API doc that I can bookmark? I can't use ctrl+D to bookmark instabase.com/docs/ (http://instabase.com/docs/) because it will redirect to https://instabase.com/docs/23.07 (I still can manually add it to my bookmark).
For example, can we add a page instabase.com/docs/latest (http://instabase.com/docs/latest) that directly renders the latest doc?
@Xindi Xu, I’m not sure I understand your question. 23.07 is the latest set of docs.

that’s why instabase.com/docs (http://instabase.com/docs) or instabase.com/docs/latest (http://instabase.com/docs/latest) is supposed to redirect to instabase.com/docs/23.07/ (http://instabase.com/docs/23.07/)

Imagine someone wants to bookmark the API doc:
1. go to instabase.com/docs/latest (http://instabase.com/docs/latest) will redirect to instabase.com/docs/23.07/ (http://instabase.com/docs/23.07/)
2. hit ctrl+D to add bookmark to the browser. It will be saved as  instabase.com/docs/23.07/ (http://instabase.com/docs/23.07/)
3. in a few months, I click the bookmark to go to the API doc, it will bring me back to instabase.com/docs/23.07/ (http://instabase.com/docs/23.07/), but not the latest version (say 23.10).
So, I wonder if we can have a stable instabase.com/docs/latest (http://instabase.com/docs/latest) that won't redirect users to instabase.com/docs/23.07/ (http://instabase.com/docs/23.07/), rather, it just renders the same content as instabase.com/docs/23.07/ (http://instabase.com/docs/23.07/).

Ohhhh, yes, I see what you mean.

Yes, I’ve been thinking today about something along these lines too, although my ideas were based more on the fact that the redirects seem to be much more complicated than expected.

We’ve just finished automating our deployments this morning, so let me think over the weekend about how we might want to deploy this.
